title: In a chapter 7 bk?
question: after you list all the your creditors, can you choose to keep your credit cards open or do not Include them in your filling????
answers: All creditors must be scheduled in your bankruptcy filing. Most creditors will revoke the credit privileges. After discharge and termination of your case, you can apply for a secured credit card. Two popular secured cards with no annual fees are Discover Card and Capital One.
I agree with the counsel above. The debtor is to disclose all assets and debtors in the schedules. This is found in Bankruptcy Code 521. Duties of a Debtor among many more.

Must list all debts. If there was no balance owed when you filed, then
you would not need to list. But you may not be able to charge on the account
after the filing. How about putting 10% of your income away each check for a
rainy day fund to help in the future. Except for a house debt, you really don't need
credit.
You have to list all of your creditors. You don't to list any credit cards with a zero balance, but they will likely close your account anyway.

All debts must be listed if you owe them anything. You will have to sign your petition under penalty of perjury that you listed all debts and all assets and that all information provided to the court is true and correct.

Remember, BK is more than checking boxes on forms you find online. Find/consult/hire a lawyer in your area using the Avvo feature "Find a Lawyer". Make a list of 4-5 having many 5 star reviews from satisfied clients. If you don't get a prompt call back from one, go on to the next on your list. Some offer a free consultation by phone or in person. Take us up on it.

Because the bankruptcy process can be handled entirely by phone, email and fax, there is no need to personally visit the lawyer’s office unless you want to. Don’t be limited by the location of the BK lawyers you select.

You must list all the people to whom you owe money in your schedules. If you don't owe money on a card, it doesn't need to be listed.
That said, it is highly likely that the credit card account will be closed after you file, since the companies keep track of bankruptcy filings.
I suggest you discuss your situation with an experienced bankruptcy attorney, so that you understand the legal requirements and ramifications of filing.
